intro: Hirtella zanzibarica subsp. thouarsiana, commonly known as Zanzibar hirtella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in secondary forests or along rocky outcrops. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for horticultural cultivation.
